ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 21
ygData.msgSnippet: I m on Fennin ro, and have checked out prices (been about a week and a half) from Qeynos to Freeport. I ve seen many of the prices you listed, but those would
ygData.messageBody:
I'm on Fennin ro, and have checked out prices (been about a week and a half)
from Qeynos to Freeport. I've seen many of the prices you listed, but those
would be the best end prices...

Bracers for 8-10 is accurate.
Tunic and cloak for 20 is accurate
I haven't seen legs go for less than 20pp.
Most everything else I've bought for 12-15pp.

And, It's been a week and a half and I don't check out prices anymore. I
bought all my stuff from the people who had it.


QUESTION: I've heard Medium banded is lighter than Large banded. I'm a
barbarian warrior, and someone told me I needed large so I bought some large
stuff (bracers, helm, mantle, boots, etc). Then I got a medium tunic and
legs. Still need to get a cloak and mask.

Problem is, I can't carry squat now... With the basic essentials (armor, two
mino axes, and 3 backpacks plus food), I'm at like 80/119 weight. Wondering
if I changed my large banded over to medium banded if it would be worth it.
And, can Barbarians wear anything large and anything medium? Someone told me
they can wear SOME medium stuff, but all large worked. Seems stupid to me,
but I'm not sure anymore...

-Zantaer, Fennin Ro, 15th Circle Barbarian Warrior

-----Original Message-----
From: Nick [mailto:brutalny@...]
Sent: Friday, May 14, 1999 8:25 AM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Digest Number 21


From: "Nick" <brutalny@...>

I play on fennin-ro and these are the accepted prices for banded. they seem
a bit low..

Banded Tunic : 20pp
banded cloak : 20pp
Sleeves: 10pp
helm: 10-12pp
boots: 10pp
bracer: 8-10pp (seen go as low as 5pp a piece)
legs: 10-12
mask: 10pp
gorget: 8-10pp

These prices seem sort of low.

Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Digest Number 21

> Message: 1
> Date: Thu, 13 May 1999 13:27:59 -0700
> From: "Golbez" <golbez01@...>
> Subject: Re: (no subject)
>
> Hail and well met lads. I made a separate character to purchase water and
> molds in East Freeport. I'd just like to say that a dark elf with 134
> intelligence makes a very good and cost effective smith. I've spent maybe
> at the MOST 80 pp in getting to 100 skill. I spent 15 practice points
right
> off and then sharpened until trivial. Then scalers until 41 trivial and
now
> I'm still making skewers even at 100 skill. I'm wondering how far skewers
> will advance you? And also what skill level would give you about 50%
> success rate making tunic, legs, helm
>
> On another note on the E'ci server there's a group of merchants selling
> banded tunics for as low as 15 pp ... this destroys mine and every other
> smith of the server's hard work. They're selling sleeves for 8 pp for
gods
> sake! People level 10 were not meant to afford a full suit of banded mail
> and these smiths run a fairly large operation I'm told by fellow smiths
that
> they number into the 30's and are a blacksmithing guild. What is there
that
> can be done? Anything?
>
>
>
>
____________________________________________________________________________
___
>
____________________________________________________________________________
___
>

> On Bertoxxulous, we run a similar guild (we have tailors, jewelsmiths,
> potters, everything). However, we don't charge insanely low prices (they
> must operate on sheer volume), and so we make a sizable profit and can
> afford bronze mail or dual combines, etc.
>
> Have you tried asking them why they price everything so low?
>
